H0.text: Potassium is the element most likely to have a melting point similar to chromium, which is characterized by a very high melting point.

H1.text: Manganese is the element that most likely has a similar high melting point to chromium, as identified using the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H2.text: Bromine is the element most likely to have a melting point similar to chromiumâ€™s very high melting point, as identified using the Periodic Table of the Elements.

H3.text: Krypton is the element that most likely has a melting point similar to chromium's very high melting point, as identified using the Periodic Table of the Elements.

A4.text: Potassium is the second least dense metal after lithium. It is a soft solid with a low melting point, and can be easily cut with a knife.

A5.text: At standard conditions for temperature and pressure it is a liquid; the only other element that is liquid under these conditions is mercury.
